ACm.caption: Continuously track?
ACm.doc: If checked, will repeatedly track the user, allowing you to watch their movements. Useful for navigation, alerting if user is entering some area, create movement record and more. Testing in a PC browser this ran once every 5 seconds, so any events you tie to this may fire that often.
ACm.name: watch

ACn.caption: Center view?
ACn.doc: If checked, automatically sets the map view to the user location with respect to detection accuracy, or to world view if geolocation failed.
ACn.name: view

ACp.caption: High accuracy?
ACp.doc: Indicates the application would like to receive the best possible results. If checked and if the device is able to provide a more accurate position, it will do so. Note that this can result in slower response times or increased power consumption (with a GPS chip on a mobile device for example). On the other hand, if false (the default value), the device can take the liberty to save resources by responding more quickly and/or using less power.
ACp.name: high_accuracy

ACq.caption: Data collected from tracking will be available on their respective map element (Leafy Map X) states.
ACq.name: data_collected_from_tracking_will_be_available_on_their_respective_map_element_(leafy_map_x)_states.
